column4: i was running the system tester on ubuntu and it froze up and i cant close it. is there a killall command for closing it?
check the Processes tab in the System > Administration > System Monitor application
i suppose I should have mentioned System Tester goes by the name "checkbox-gtk" :)
ok ended the process but it is still on the desktop
it might be hung hard enough to prevent the relatively gentle "end" request. right click on that process and click the "kill process" menu item
it is gone from the process's list.
but the window is still on the desktop?
maybe you just need a screen refresh. try switching virtual desktops and switching back using the applet in the lower right hand corner of the screen
ok moved it to a different desktop and it closed
great :) it had closed, but gnome hadn't refreshed the screen, that's all. glad we could help!
